ru.tinkoff.decoro.watchers

Class FormatWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.tinkoff.decoro.watchers.FormatWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.text.NoCopySpan, android.text.TextWatcher, MaskFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DescriptorFormatWatcher, MaskFormatWatcher

    public abstract class FormatWatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.text.TextWatcher, MaskFactory

    This class encapsulates logic of formatting (pretty printing) content of a TextView. All the formatting logic is encapsulated inside the Mask class. This class is only used to follow TextView changes and format it according to the Mask. It's okay to use it either with TextView or EditText. Important note for using with bare TextView. Since its content usually changes with TextView.setText(java.lang.CharSequence), inserting text should contain all the hardcoded symbols of the Mask.

    All the children classes should implement their own way of creating Mask.

    • Method Detail

      • installOn

        public void installOn(android.widget.TextView textView)
        Starts to follow text changes in the specified TextView to format any input.
        IMPORTANT: this call will force watcher to re-create the mask
        Parameters:
        textView - text view to watch and format

      • installOnAndFill

        public void installOnAndFill(android.widget.TextView textView)
        Starts to follow text changes in the specified TextView to format any input. Initial mask's value (e.g. hardcoded head) will be displayed in the view.
        IMPORTANT: this call will force watcher to re-create the mask
        Parameters:
        textView - text view to watch and format

      • installOn

        protected void installOn(android.widget.TextView textView,
                         boolean initWithMask)
        Parameters:
        textView - an observable text view which content text will be formatted using Mask
        initWithMask - this flags defines whether hardcoded head of the mask (e.g "+7 ") will fill the initial text of the textView.
